summary: Build a motivational job-hunt tracking app that lets the user log each job application and increment a counter to stay motivated.

existing_features.title: Create a simple home screen that shows the user’s total number of job applications and provides a primary action to increment the count by 1 each time the user applies.
Allow the user to log a lightweight entry for each application (at minimum: date/time; optional fields: company, role, notes) and view recent entries in a list.

Add lightweight motivation UI elements: show a short encouraging message that changes based on the current count (e.g., 0, 1–4, 5–9, 10+), and a simple milestone indicator (e.g., “Next milestone: 10”).

Implement a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) with a calm, supportive look and consistent layout across screens. Do not use a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add the required generated image asset(s) to the frontend as static files and display the main illustration on the home screen (e.g., header/hero area).

Add a Reminder Settings UI that lets an authenticated user enable/disable reminders and configure a simple schedule (at minimum: frequency = daily, time of day). The UI must be accessible from the main authenticated experience (e.g., Home screen or App header) and use English user-facing text.

Implement reminder delivery in the frontend as an in-app reminder system with optional browser Notification API support when permissions are granted. The app must gracefully fall back to an in-app banner/dialog when notifications are not supported or permission is denied, and must not rely on push notifications.

Add a motivational “keep the fire on” animation to the Home screen that visually conveys ongoing momentum (e.g., a flame/flicker badge near the main count). The animation must be smooth, lightweight, and consistent with the existing warm theme (no blue/purple-dominant styling).

Trigger a short celebratory animation state when a new application entry is successfully logged (e.g., brief intensification of the flame/flicker or a subtle burst), using the existing ApplicationEntryForm onSuccess hook to coordinate UI feedback.

new_feature_requests.summary: Job application tracker with an incrementing counter each time the user applies (motivation-focused)
Persist the user’s counter and application log entries in the Motoko backend keyed by the signed-in Internet Identity principal so progress is retained across sessions.
Add reminder notifications so the user gets prompted to apply/log applications on a schedule
Add a motivational animation (e.g., “fire”/streak effect) to keep the experience engaging

Persist reminder settings per signed-in user in the Motoko backend and expose methods to read and update them. Access control must match existing profile/entry methods (only the caller can read/update their own settings unless admin).
